title: Erddig Walks

images.caption: Formal garden at Erddig. The zig-zag hedge is box and the trees are clipped yew.

images.caption: Carriage Driving in Erddig Park. This carriage has "Tandem" horses. The Erddig Doocot can be seen in the background.

images.caption: Erddig " Cup & Saucer ". The lower part of the Hydraulic Ram which provided water for the Hall. Autumnal trees in the background.

images.caption: Cathedral Walk. The popular tree lined walk in autumn.

images.title: Some of the outbuildings at Erddig Hall by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Some of the outbuildings

description: Explore the 1,200-acre country park surrounding the 18th century Erddig Hall in Wrexham. You can enjoy a riverside stroll along the River Clywedog, visit the 13.5-acre walled garden with fruit trees and water features before exploring the huge parkland, rolling farmland and woodland areas. Cyclists can also enjoy the park with a particularly lovely trail running along the river. You can also tour the impressive Erddig Hall with its grand rooms, furniture and gallery. There are a number of interesting outbuildings with stables, a smithy, a joiners' shop and a sawmill too.
